bibl.title: Marion Fair v. Territory of Washington. Petition
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: M. Fair vs Territory of Washington | Territory of Washington County of Walla Walla Petition for writ of Habeas Corpus
To the Honorable E.P Oliphant Judge 1st Judicial Dist W.T.

Your petitioner M. Fair complains that he is illegally restrained of his liberty at the city Walla Walla y Lambs Buckley therewith of said county on a charge of Grand Larceny The illegality of said restraint consists in the facts that there is no legal evidence of the crimes petition and that it is unheard in fact, He prays that a writ of Habeas Corpus may be ganted & that your Honor will inquire unto to the charge and that your petitioner may be discharged from said illegal restraint
Subscribed and sworn to before me the 13th day of August 1862
M. Fair vs Territory of Washington
Aug. 14 1862 Filed allowed by E.P. Oliphant First Jud NSNY
Filed August 14th 1863 B. N. Secton Clerk
